metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4054 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in Squid 3.x before 3.5.17 and 4.x before 4.0.9 allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted Edge Side Includes(ESI) responses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2').
